English: a man (and) a ladder on a tree
Español: (un) hombre (y) una escalera en un árbol

English: (The ladder) is resting on the tree
Español: (la escalera está) apoyada en el árbol

English: The man had climbed the ladder
Español: el hombre había subido la escalera

English: (and) he is at the top of the ladder.
Español: (y) está en la cima de la escalera.

English: and depositing them in his apron.
Español: y las guarda en el mandil.

English: empties the pears from the apron.
A man comes along later with a goat
Español: Más tarde vienen (un) hombre junto con (una) cabra

English: and come [near and then walk away] the man and the goat
Español: pasan [se acercan y se alejan] el hombre y la cabra

English: A child on a bicycle comes next
Español: Más tarde se acerca (un) niño con (una) bicicleta

English: The boy looks at the baskets and then at the man in the tree
Español: El niño ve aquello [las cestas] ve (al hombre en el árbol)

English: The man was unaware (of whatever was happening)
Español: el hombre ignoraba (lo que estaba pasando)

English: to put... put the basket of pears on
Español: puso... puso el cesto de peras (encima)

English: puts the basket on the bicycle
Español: pone la cesta sobre la bicicleta

English: (The boy cycles away on) the bike
Español: (El niño se va en la) bicicleta

English: The boy is stunned (and gazes at her)
(and) his hat falls to the floor
He is spellbound and looks back
Español: Él iba embobado mirando hacia atrás

English: (and) his hat falls to the floor
He is spellbound and looks back
(and the pears) get scattered on the floor
Three children happen to pass by
They put the pears (in the basket)
The boy gives one of the children
Español: El niño le regala a uno de los niños

English: The child [on the bicycle] also leaves
Español: el niño [de la bicicleta] se marcha

English: (The child) [with the two pears also] leaves
Español: (el niño) [de las dos peras] se marcha

English: because he picked up the hat
they helped me to gather [the pears] that’s it
Español: antes me ayudaron a coger [las peras] y nada

English: They then gave me the hat
He gives them two pears because of the hat.
Español: les regala las peras por lo de el sombrero.

English: The child on the bicycle leaves
Español: El niño de la bicicleta se va

English: Climbs down from the top [of the tree]
(but) before that the man had noticed
that there were three baskets of pears there
Español: (que) ahí había tres cestas de peras

English: One was missing (where could it be?)
